title: Get the results of a split test

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

fields.name: split_test_status
fields.description: Status of the split test. Enum values: UNKNOWN : The status of the split test is unavailable. NOT_STARTED : The split test has not started because the start_time of the split test has not arrived yet. IN_PROGRESS : The split test is running. REPORTING_GENERATING : The end_time of the split test has passed and a report is being generated. COMPLETED : The split test either ends automatically, or is manually stopped via /split_test/end/ . CANCELLED : The split test was canceled before the start_time . This enum value is only available for campaign level split test.

fields.name: split_test_level
fields.description: Split test level. Enum values: ADGROUP (Ad group level split test.) CAMPAIGN (Campaign level split test.)

fields.name: object_info
fields.description: Information about the two ad groups that are associated with the split test.

fields.name: optimization_goal
fields.description: Optimization goal of the ad group. For enum values, see Enumeration - Optimization Goal .

fields.name: cells
fields.description: Cell list of the split test.

fields.name: object_ids
fields.description: List of campaign_id or adgroup_id in the cell that are associated with the split test.

fields.name: test_variable
fields.description: Split test variable. Enum values: BIDDING_OPTIMIZATION : Set different optimization values for bidding & optimization fields to compare how optimization methods impact your ad performance. TARGTING : Set different targeting values at the ad group level for comparing how effective your ad groups are at reaching different audiences or demographics. CREATIVE : Set different creatives to compare how different creatives impact your ad performance. CUSTOM : Set multiple variables to compare how these variables impact your ad performance. This enum value is only available for campaign level split test.

fields.name: key_metric
fields.description: The key metric when you created this split test. If no value is specified for this field, the following default values will be used: For ad group level split test, if both ad groups use REACH optimization goal, the default key metric will be COST_PER_REACH . Otherwise, the default key metric will be COST_PER_SHOW . For campaign level split test, the default key metric is UNSET .

fields.name: start_time
fields.description: The start time of this split test, in the format of YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (ad account time zone). Example: 2022-01-01 00:00:00 .

fields.name: end_time
fields.description: The end time of this split test, in the format of YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (ad account time zone). Example: 2022-01-01 00:00:00 .

fields.name: metric
fields.description: Metric name. UNSET : Unset. CONVERT_RATE : CVR (Conversion rate). CLICK_THROUGH_RATE : Click through rate (CTR). COST_PER_SHOW : Cost per mille (CPM). COST_PER_CONVERT : Cost per conversion. COST_PER_REACH : Cost per reach. COST_PER_CLICK : Cost per click. COST_PER_FOCUSED_VIEW : Cost per focused view. FOCUSED_VIEW_RATE : Focused view rate. COMPLETE_PAYMENT_ROAS : Complete Payment ROAS. COST_PER_LANDING_PAGE_VIEW : Cost per landing page view. LANDING_PAGE_VIEW_RATE : Landing page view rate. CLICK : Click. REACH : Reach. SHOW : Impression. CONVERT : Conversion. COST : Cost.

fields.name: p_value
fields.description: P value of each metric. There will be a winning ad group or campaign when the p value <= 0.1.

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: The log id of the request, which uniquely identifies a request.
